value.original: The Table and Column Window defines all tables with their columns

row.value: The Table and Column Window defines all tables with their columns

value.original: The Reference Window defines each field type and its parameters. This window is for System Admin use only.

row.value: The Reference Window defines field/display types and validations. This window is for System Admin use only.

value.original: The Window, Tab & Field Window defines the presentation of tables and columns within each window.

row.value: The Window, Tab & Field Window defines the presentation of tables and columns within each window.

value.original: Maintain dynamic Validation Rules for columns and fields

row.value: Maintain dynamic Validation Rules for columns and fields

value.original: The Validation Rules Window defines all dynamic rules used when entering and maintaining columns and fields. This window is for System Admin use only.

row.value: The Validation Rules Window defines all dynamic rules used when entering and maintaining columns and fields. This window is for System Admin use only.

value.original: The Message Window defines the Message Text and Message Tips for each system generated message. It is for System Admin use only.

row.value: The Message Window defines the Message Text and Message Tips for each system generated message. It is for System Admin use only.

value.original: The Maintain Menu Window defines the Menu which will display. It is for System Admin use only. The menu items that each user will see depends upon the security defined.

row.value: The Maintain Menu Window defines the Menu which will display. It is for System Admin use only. The menu items that each user will see depends upon the security defined.

value.original: The Language Window allows you to define multiple parallel language for users. This allows users to access the same data but have the windows, tabs and fields appear in different languages.If a language is a System Language, you can change the User Interface to this language (after translation). Otherwise the language is only used for printing documents. For the language code, we suggest using the Java convention of country and language (e.g. fr_CN - Canadian French). Verify the translation creates missing translation records. Start this process after creating a new language.

row.value:
The Language Window allows you to define multiple parallel language for users. This allows users to access the same data but have the windows, tabs and fields appear in different languages. If a language is a System Language, you can change the User Interface to this language (after translation). Otherwise the language is only used for printing documents.
For the language code, we suggest using the Java convention of country and language (e.g. fr_CN - Canadian French).
Verify the translation creates missing translation records. Start this process after creating a new language.
View detals of matched invoice lines to material receipt lines

value.original: The User Window allows you to define each User of the system. Users can log into the system and have access to functionality via one or more roles.

row.value: The User Window allows you to maintain User of the system. Users can log into the system and have access to functionality via one or more roles. A user can also be a business aprtner contact.

value.original: The Client is the highest level of an independent business entity. Each Client will have one or more Organizations reporting to it. Each Client defines the accounting parameters (Accounting Schema, Tree definition, Non Monetary UOM's).Do not create a new client in this window, but use "Initial Client Setup" to set up the required security and access rules. If you create a new client here, you will not be able to view it and also the required client infrastructure would not have been set up.

row.value: The Client is the highest level of an independent business entity. Each Client will have one or more Organizations reporting to it. Each Client defines the accounting parameters (Accounting Schema, Tree definition, Non Monetary UOM's). To create new Clients, run the Initial Client Setup with the System Administrator Role. Do not create a new client in this window, but use "Initial Client Setup" to set up the required security and access rules. If you create a new client here, you will not be able to view it and also the required client infrastructure would not have been set up.

value.original: The Organization Window allows you to define and maintain Organizational entities. An Organization is often a legal entity or sub-unit for which documents and transactions are processed

row.value: The Organization Window allows you to define and maintain Organizational entities. An Organization is often a legal entity or sub-unit for which documents and transactions are processed

value.original: The Role Window allows you to define the different roles that users of this system will have. Roles control access to windows, tasks, reports, etc. For a client an Administrator and User role are predefined. You may add additional roles to control access for specific functionality or data.You can add users to the role.

row.value: The Role Window allows you to define the different roles that users of this system will have. Roles control access to windows, tasks, reports, etc. For a client an Administrator and User role are predefined. You may add additional roles to control access for specific functionality or data. You can add users to the role. Note that access information is cached and requires re-login or reset of cache.

value.original: The Sequence Window defines how document numbers will be sequenced.Change the way document numbers are generated. You may add a prefix or a suffix or change the current number.

row.value: The Sequence Window defines how document numbers will be sequenced. Change the way document numbers are generated. You may add a prefix or a suffix or change the current number.

value.original: The Workflow Window defines Workflows in the system, the access level for the Workflow and the Nodes or Steps within the Workflow.

row.value: The Workflow Window defines Workflows in the system, the access level for the Workflow and the Nodes or Steps within the Workflow.

value.original: The Maintain Tasks window defines the different tasks used in workflows and the access level for those tasks.

row.value: The Maintain Tasks window defines the different tasks used in workflows and the access level for those tasks.

value.original: The Currency Window defines any currency which will be used in documents or reporting. You would define used currencies on System level and add currencies on Client level only for statistical currencies (e.g. for instable currencies)

row.value: The Currency Window defines any currency which will be used in documents or reporting. You would define used currencies on System level and add currencies on Client level only for statistical currencies (e.g. for instable currencies)

value.original: The Conversion Rates window is used to define the conversion rates that will be used when converting document amounts from one currency to another

row.value: The Conversion Rates window is used to define the conversion rates that will be used when converting document amounts from one currency to another. Note that only the multiply rate is used; The divide rate is for visualization only.

value.original: The Calendar Year and Periods defines the calendars that will be used for period control and reporting. You can also define non-standard calendars (e.g. business year from July to June).

row.value: The Calendar Year and Periods defines the calendars that will be used for period control and reporting. You can also define non-standard calendars (e.g. business year from July to June).

value.original: The Account Element Window is used to define and maintain the Accounting Element and User Defined Elements. One of the account segments is your natural account segment (Chart of Account). You may add a new account element for parallel reporting or for user defined accounting segments.

row.value: The Account Element Window is used to define and maintain the Accounting Element and User Defined Elements. One of the account segments is your natural account segment (Chart of Account). You may add a new account element for parallel reporting or for user defined accounting segments.

value.original: The Unit of Measure Window is used to define non monetary units of measure. It also defines if conversion between units of measure are allowed and how they are to be performed. The system provides some automatic conversions between units of measures (e.g. minute, hour, day, working day, etc.) if they are not explicitly defined here.Conversions need to be direct (i.e. if you have only a conversion between A-B and B-C, the system cannot convert A-C, you need to define it explicitly).

row.value: The Unit of Measure Window is used to define non monetary units of measure. It also defines if conversion between units of measure are allowed and how they are to be performed. The system provides some automatic conversions between units of measures (e.g. minute, hour, day, working day, etc.) if they are not explicitly defined here. Conversions need to be direct (i.e. if you have only a conversion between A-B and B-C, the system cannot convert A-C, you need to define it explicitly).

value.original: The Location Window defines the address data within the system. This window is for System Admin only. Users would access location entries using the location button or tab on the appropriate window (i.e Order Entry or Business Partner)

row.value: The Location Window defines the address data within the system. This window is for System Admin only. Users would access location entries using the location button or tab on the appropriate window (i.e Order Entry or Business Partner)

value.original:
The Countries, Regions and Cities Window defines the different entities that can be used in any address field. It defines the format of the address as well as associating Regions with Countries and Cities with Regions or Countries.

You would define Countries usually only on System level.

row.value:
The Countries, Regions and Cities Window defines the different entities that can be used in any address field. It defines the format of the address as well as associating Regions with Countries and Cities with Regions or Countries.

You would define Countries usually only on System level.

value.original: The Business Partner window allows you do define any party with whom you transact. This includes customers, vendors and employees. Prior to entering or importing products, you must define your vendors. Prior to generating Orders you must define your customers. This window holds all information about your business partner and the values entered will be used to generate all document transactions

row.value: The Business Partner window allows you do define any party with whom you transact. This includes customers, vendors and employees. Prior to entering or importing products, you must define your vendors. Prior to generating Orders you must define your customers. This window holds all information about your business partner and the values entered will be used to generate all document transactions

value.original: Maintain Accounting Schema - For changes to become effective you must re-login

row.value: Maintain Accounting Schema - For changes to become effective you must re-login

value.original: The Accounting Schema Window defines an accounting method and the elements that will comprise an account structure. Create and activate elements for detailed accounting for Business Partners, Products, Locations, etc.Review and change the GL and Default accounts. The actual accounts used in transactions depend on the executing organization; Most of the information is derived from the context.

row.value: The Accounting Schema Window defines an accounting method and the elements that will comprise an account structure. Create and activate elements for detailed accounting for Business Partners, Products, Locations, etc. Review and change the GL and Default accounts. The actual accounts used in transactions depend on the executing organization; Most of the information is derived from the context.

value.original: For System Maintenance Only. The Maintain Attachments window is used for diagnostic purposes to display the attributes of an attachment.

row.value: For System Maintenance Only. The Maintain Attachments window is used for diagnostic purposes to display the attributes of an attachment.

value.original: Maintain System Client Org and User Preferences

row.value: Maintain System Client Org and User Preferences

value.original: The Project Window is used to define the projects which will be tracked via documents.

row.value: The Project Window is used to define the projects which will can be tracked by phases and tasks.

value.original: The GL Category Window allows you to define categories to be used in journals. These categories provide a method of optionally grouping and reporting on journals.

row.value: The GL Category Window allows you to define categories to be used in journals. These categories provide a method of optionally grouping and reporting on journals.

value.original: Enter and change Manual Journal Entries

row.value: Enter and change Manual Journal Entries

value.original: The GL Journal Window allows you to enter and modify manual journal entries

row.value: The GL Journal Window allows you to enter and modify manual journal entries

value.original: Maintain Activities for Activity Based Costing

row.value: Maintain Activities for Activity Based Costing

value.original: The Activity Based Costing Window defines the different activities for which you want to capture costs.

row.value: The Activity Based Costing Window defines the different activities for which you want to capture costs.

value.original: The Document Type Window defines any document to be used in the system. Each document type provides the basis for processing of each document and controls the printed name and document sequence used.

row.value: The Document Type Window defines any document to be used in the system. Each document type provides the basis for processing of each document and controls the printed name and document sequence used.

value.original: The Maintain Approvals Window is used to define the different approvals that are used in workflows.

row.value: The Maintain Approvals Window is used to define the different approvals that are used in workflows.

value.original: The Tax Rate Window defines the different taxes used for each tax category. For example, Sales Tax must be defined for each State in which it applies.

row.value: The Tax Rate Window defines the different taxes used for each tax category. For example, Sales Tax must be defined for each State in which it applies.

value.original: The Tax Category Window is used to enter and maintain Tax Categories. Each product is associated with a tax category which facilitates reacting changing tax rates.

row.value: The Tax Category Window is used to enter and maintain Tax Categories. Each product is associated with a tax category which facilitates reacting changing tax rates.

value.original: The Warehouse and Locators Window defines each Warehouse, any Locators for that Warehouse and the Accounting parameters to be used for inventory in that Warehouse.

row.value: The Warehouse and Locators Window defines each Warehouse, any Locators for that Warehouse and the Accounting parameters to be used for inventory in that Warehouse.

value.original: The Product Window defines all products used by an organization. These products include those sold to customers, used in the manufacture of products sold to customers and products purchased by an organization.

row.value: The Product Window defines all products used by an organization. These products include those sold to customers, used in the manufacture of products sold to customers and products purchased by an organization.

value.original: The Payment Terms Window defines the different payment terms that you offer your customers and that are offered to you by your vendors. Each invoice must contain a Payment Term. On the standard invoice, the Name and the Document Note of the Payment Term is printed.

row.value: The Payment Terms Window defines the different payment terms that you offer your customers and that are offered to you by your vendors. Each invoice must contain a Payment Term. On the standard invoice, the Name and the Document Note of the Payment Term is printed.

value.original: The Shipper Window defines the different shipping provides used by an Organization. When a delivery method of Shipper is used on an Order a predefined Shipper must be selected.

row.value: The Shipper Window defines the different shipping provides used by an Organization. When a delivery method of Shipper is used on an Order a predefined Shipper must be selected.

value.original: The Order Window allows you to enter and modify Sales Orders.

row.value: The Order Window allows you to enter and modify Sales Orders.

value.original: The Product Category allows you to define different groups of products. These groups can be used in generating Price Lists, defining margins and for easily assigning different accounting parameters for products.

row.value: The Product Category allows you to define different groups of products. These groups can be used in generating Price Lists, defining margins and for easily assigning different accounting parameters for products.

value.original:
The Price List Window allows you to generate product price lists for your Business Partners. Price lists determine currency and tax treatment. Price list versions allow to maintain parallel lists for different date ranges. The most current pricelist version is used based on the document date.
All pricelists have three prices: List, Standard and Limit
First step is to create a base price list. You can manually add products and enter the prices or create them automatically. The base price list is often the purchase price list with list price ('official' retail price), the standard price (your purchase price). The limit price can be used to check your final purchase costs after discounts, rebates, etc.
Pricelists can be calculated and copied. To speed up the calculation, the parameters are stored an used when creating a new price list version.

row.value:
The Price List Window allows you to generate product price lists for your Business Partners. Price lists determine currency and tax treatment. Price list versions allow to maintain parallel lists for different date ranges. The most current pricelist version is used based on the document date.
All pricelists have three prices: List, Standard and Limit
First step is to create a base price list. You can manually add products and enter the prices or create them automatically. The base price list is often the purchase price list with list price ('official' retail price), the standard price (your purchase price). The limit price can be used to check your final purchase costs after discounts, rebates, etc.
Pricelists can be calculated and copied. To speed up the calculation, the parameters are stored an used when creating a new price list version.

value.original: The Invoice Schedule Window defines the frequency and cut off dates for generating summary invoices. If a customer requires a single invoice for multiple shipments you would define the appropriate invoice schedule and associate it with the Customer.

row.value: The Invoice Schedule Window defines the frequency and cut off dates for generating summary invoices. If a customer requires a single invoice for multiple shipments you would define the appropriate invoice schedule and associate it with the Customer.

value.original: The Marketing Campaign Window defines the start and end date for a campaign. It also gives a running balance of the invoice amounts which referred to this campaign.

row.value: The Marketing Campaign Window defines the start and end date for a campaign. It also gives a running balance of the invoice amounts which referred to this campaign.

value.original: The Marketing Channel Window defines the different channels used in Marketing Campaigns

row.value: The Marketing Channel Window defines the different channels used in Marketing Campaigns

value.original: The System Element Window is the Central Repository for Field Names Descriptions and Help/Comments

row.value: The System Element Window is the Central Repository for Field Names Descriptions and Help/Comments

value.original: The Sales Region Window defines the different regions where you do business. You can generate reports based on Sales Regions

row.value: The Sales Region Window defines the different regions where you do business. You can generate reports based on Sales Regions

value.original: The Account Combination Window defines and displays valid account combinations.

row.value: The Account Combination Window defines and displays valid account combinations.

value.original: The Bank Window is used to define the banks and accounts associated with an organization or business partner

row.value: The Bank Window is used to define the banks and accounts associated with an organization or business partner

value.original: The Dunning Window defines the parameters that will be used when generating Dunning Letters. Each customer can be associated with a Dunning Code.

row.value: The Dunning Window defines the parameters that will be used when generating Dunning Letters. Each customer can be associated with a Dunning Code.

value.original: The Withholding Window defines the rule used for calculating withholding amounts.

row.value: The Withholding Window defines the rule used for calculating withholding amounts.

value.original: The Charges Window defines the different charges that may be incurred. These can include Bank Charges, Vendor Charges and Handling Charges.

row.value: The Charges Window defines the different charges that may be incurred. These can include Bank Charges, Vendor Charges and Handling Charges.

value.original: The Tree and Node Image Window defines the descriptors and images that will be used when a Tree is displayed.

row.value: The Tree Window defines the descriptors and images that will be used when a Tree is displayed.

value.original: The Report & Process Window is used to define the parameters and access rules for every Report and Process within the system. This window is for System Admin use only.

row.value: The Report & Process Window is used to define the parameters and access rules for every Report and Process within the system. This window is for System Admin use only.

value.original: The Customer Invoice Window allows you to display and enter invoices for a customer. Invoices can also be generated from Sales Orders or Delivery documents.

row.value: The Customer Invoice Window allows you to display and enter invoices for a customer. Invoices can also be generated from Sales Orders or Delivery documents.

value.original: The Physical Inventory Window allows you to generate inventory count lists. These counts can then be processed which will update the actual inventory with the new counts.

row.value: The Physical Inventory Window allows you to generate inventory count lists. These counts can then be processed which will update the actual inventory with the new counts. Normally you would create inventory count lines automaticelly. If you create them manually, make sure that the book value is correct.

value.original: The Shipment Window defines shipments made or to be made to a customer. They are generated from an Customer Order. The Shipment Document will generate the Customer Invoice.

row.value: The Shipment Window defines shipments made or to be made to a customer. They are generated from an Customer Order. The Shipment Document will generate the Customer Invoice.

value.original: The Inventory Move Window allows you to move inventory from one location or warehouse to another. After the appropriate lines are entered selecting the 'Process Movements' button will adjust the inventory.

row.value: The Inventory Move Window allows you to move inventory from one location or warehouse to another. After the appropriate lines are entered selecting the 'Process Movements' button will adjust the inventory.

value.original: The Import Business Partner Window is an interim table which is used when importing external data into the system. Selecting the 'Process' button will either add or modify the appropriate records.

row.value: The Import Business Partner Window is an interim table which is used when importing external data into the system. Selecting the 'Process' button will either add or modify the appropriate records.

value.original: The Revenue Recognition Window defines the intervals at which revenue will be recognized. Alternatively, the revenue recognition may be linked to service levels provided.

row.value: The Revenue Recognition Window defines the intervals at which revenue will be recognized. Alternatively, the revenue recognition may be linked to service levels provided.

value.original: The Perpetual Inventory defines the rules to be applied when generating Physical Inventory counts.

row.value: The Perpetual Inventory defines the rules to be applied when generating Physical Inventory counts.

value.original: The Vendor Details Window allows you to display and maintain all products for a selected Vendor.

row.value: The Vendor Details Window allows you to display and maintain all products for a selected Vendor.

value.original: The Greeting Window defines a greeting that is then associated with a Business Partner or Business Partner Contact.

row.value: The Greeting Window defines a greeting that is then associated with a Business Partner or Business Partner Contact.

value.original: The Report View Window defines the views used when generating reports. This window is for System Admin use only.

row.value: The Report View Window defines the views used when generating reports. This window is for System Admin use only.

value.original: The Purchase Order Window defines a purchase order for an organization. When a Purchase Order has been entered you can generate a Shipment Document or Invoice from this Purchase Order

row.value: The Purchase Order Window defines a purchase order for an organization. When a Purchase Order has been entered you can generate a Shipment Document or Invoice from this Purchase Order

value.original: The Vendor Invoice Window allows you to display and enter Invoices from a Vendor. Vendor Invoices can also be generated from Purchase Orders or Delivery Receipts.

row.value: The Vendor Invoice Window allows you to display and enter Invoices from a Vendor. Vendor Invoices can also be generated from Purchase Orders or Delivery Receipts.

value.original: The Vendor Shipment Window defines the receipt of product or material from a Vendor. The Shipment may be manually entered or may be generated from a Purchase Order or Vendor Invoice.

row.value: The Vendor Shipment Window defines the receipt of product or material from a Vendor. The Shipment may be manually entered or may be generated from a Purchase Order or Vendor Invoice.

value.original: The EDI Definition Window defines the parameters to be used when processing EDI Transactions

row.value: The EDI Definition Window defines the parameters to be used when processing EDI Transactions

value.original: The Forms Window defines any window which is not automatically generated. For System Admin use only.

row.value: The Forms Window defines any window which is not automatically generated. For System Admin use only.

value.original: The Error Message Window displays all error messages generated. This is for System Admin use only. The records must be manually deleted.

row.value: The Error Message Window displays all error messages generated. This is for System Admin use only. The records must be manually deleted.

value.original: The Import Loader Format Window is used for defining the file layout for product information which will be imported.

row.value: The Import Loader Format Window is used for defining the file layout for product information which will be imported.

value.original: Production based on Bill of Materials

row.value: Production based on Bill of Materials

value.original: The Production Window defines those plan and inventory movements that occur when a product is created from a bill of materials

row.value: The Production Window defines those plan and inventory movements that occur when a product is created from a bill of materials

value.original: The Business Partner Group window allows you to define the accounting parameters at a group level. If you define the accounting parameters for a group any Business Partner entered using this group will have these accounting parameters automatically populated. You can then make any modifications necessary at the Business Partner level.

row.value: The Business Partner Group window allows you to define the accounting parameters at a group level. If you define the accounting parameters for a group any Business Partner entered using this group will have these accounting parameters automatically populated. You can then make any modifications necessary at the Business Partner level.

value.original: The system creates messages while performing processes. In this window you can view them.

row.value: The system creates messages while performing processes. In this window you can view them.

value.original: The Process Bank Statements window allows you to reconcile your Bank Statements. You can either enter the line items from the statement in the Statement Line tab or select the 'Create From' button to automatically generate the statement from all unreconciled payments to this bank account. Once you have completed reconciling, select the 'Process Statement' button to mark the payments as reconciled and update the appropriate GL accounts.

row.value: The Process Bank Statements window allows you to reconcile your Bank Statements. You can either enter the line items from the statement in the Statement Line tab or select the 'Create From' button to automatically generate the statement from all unreconciled payments to this bank account. Once you have completed reconciling, select the 'Process Statement' button to mark the payments as reconciled and update the appropriate GL accounts.

value.original: This is a System only Window. Customer Attributes allow the entry of additional information to an entity.

row.value: This is a System only Window. Customer Attributes allow the entry of additional information to an entity.

value.original: The Cashbook Window defines the bank and account against which cash transactions will be processed.

row.value: The Cashbook Window defines the bank and account against which cash transactions will be processed.

value.original: The Cash Journal Window is used to record disbursements from and receipts to Petty Cash

row.value: The Cash Journal Window is used to record disbursements from and receipts to Petty Cash

value.original: The Field Group Window allows you to define subsections in a tab. For System Admin use only.

row.value: The Field Group Window allows you to define subsections in a tab. For System Admin use only.

value.original: The Request Window is used to define and track any request assigned to you.

row.value: The Request Window is used to define and track any request assigned to you.

value.original: The Request Processor Window allows you to define different processes that you want to occur and the frequency and timing of these processes

row.value: The Request Processor Window allows you to define different processes that you want to occur and the frequency and timing of these processes A Request Processor can be just for a specific Request Type or for all.

Mail templates can contain variables of the user, business partner or a general object. The priority of parsing is User/Contact, Business Partner and then the underlying business object (like Request, Dunning, Workflow object).
So, @Name@ would resolve into the User name (if user is defined defined), then Business Partner name (if business partner is defined) and then the Name of the business object if it has a Name.
For Multi-Lingual systems, the template is translated based on the Business Partner's language selection.

value.original: Define how and when you want the commissions to be calculated and to whom to pay it.The Commissions Window allows you define how commissions and royalties will be paid. You can pay multiple commissions for the same order or invoice (e.g. to the person entering the transaction, to the person responsible for sale of the product (category) and or business partner (group).

row.value: Define how and when you want the commissions to be calculated and to whom to pay it. The Commissions Window allows you define how commissions and royalties will be paid. You can pay multiple commissions for the same order or invoice (e.g. to the person entering the transaction, to the person responsible for sale of the product (category) and or business partner (group).

value.original: The Project Cycle Window defines the steps associated with a specific Project.You may want to define several Project cycles to differentiate the different types of projects. Project cycles may use all or a subset of the used Project Status (e.g. Your opportunity project cycle may include the steps from prospect to contract - the service cycle may include steps from installation to customer acceptance.

row.value: The Project Cycle Window defines the steps associated with a specific Project. You may want to define several Project cycles to differentiate the different types of projects. Project cycles may use all or a subset of the used Project Status (e.g. Your opportunity project cycle may include the steps from prospect to contract - the service cycle may include steps from installation to customer acceptance.

value.original: The Commission Run Window displays the results of processing commissions. When the Generate Commission process is selected from the Commissions Window, the results are displayed here. If the result is satisfactory, generate an AP invoice to pay the commission.

row.value: The Commission Run Window displays the results of processing commissions. When the Generate Commission process is selected from the Commissions Window, the results are displayed here. If the result is satisfactory, generate an AP invoice to pay the commission.

value.original: The Performance Color Window allows you to define the color schema to be used to indicate current performance. The system has predefined Red (below 50%), Yellow (below 100%) and green above 100. If you want to define your own color schema, do it here.

row.value: The Performance Color Window allows you to define the color schema to be used to indicate current performance. The system has predefined Red (below 50%), Yellow (below 100%) and green above 100. If you want to define your own color schema, do it here.

value.original: The Performance Goal Window allows you to define performance goals

row.value: The Performance Goal Window allows you to define performance goals or all, a role or a user

value.original: Define how you calculate your performance measures

row.value: Define how you calculate your performance measures

value.original: Please test the statement in SQL*Plus first.The select statement needs to return a single value!Any restrictions for Date range, Organizations, Business Partners, Products should be done via the "Performance Measure" window. This is the generic calculation.As this tends to be somewhat technical, the system has a few examples predefined.

row.value:
The Performance Measure Calculation defines how performance measures will be calculated. The sql needs to return a single value. Please check examples.
The date trestriction is defined in the Goal. Any restrictions for Organizations, Business Partners, Products, etc. are as Performance Goal Restrictions.

value.original: The Performance Achievement Window allows you to define Tasks to be achieved. The performance is measured by the percentage of reached achievements.

row.value: The Performance Achievement Window allows you to define Tasks to be achieved. The performance is measured by the percentage of reached achievements.

value.original: The Performance Measure Window allows you to define the rules and restrictions for performance measurement. You can, for example, restrict performance measurement to sales for a certain product category for a defined time frame.

row.value: The Performance Measure Window allows you to define the rules and restrictions for performance measurement. You can, for example, restrict performance measurement to sales for a certain product category for a defined time frame.

value.original: Financial Reports are the combination of a Report Column Set and Line Set.

row.value: Financial Reports are the combination of a Report Column Set and Line Set.

value.original: The Report Column Set defines what data is printed in the columns of a report.

row.value: The Report Column Set defines what data is printed in the columns of a report.

value.original: The Line Set determines, which lines are printed in a Financial Report

row.value: The Line Set determines, which lines are printed in a Financial Report

value.original: Service Levels are generated when an invoice with products based on revenue recognition rules are generated. You need to update the actual service level by adding an additional line.

row.value: Service Levels are generated when an invoice with products based on revenue recognition rules are generated. You need to update the actual service level by adding an additional line.

value.original:
Define the documents you use for this Client/Organnization. Note that the check format is defined in the Bank (Account) Window.

The highest priotity has the Print Format, you define on a Document Type (example specific Export Invoice format). The next level is the set of Print Formats, you defined for the organziation of the document printed. The default is the set of Print Formats defines for all organizations of the Client (Organization=*).

row.value:
Define the documents you use for this Client/Organnization. Note that the check format is defined in the Bank (Account) Window.

The highest priotity has the Print Format, you define on a Document Type (example specific Export Invoice format). The next level is the set of Print Formats, you defined for the organziation of the document printed. The default is the set of Print Formats defines for all organizations of the Client (Organization=*).

value.original: System colors are used for background and indicators

value.original: Desktop is a collection of Workbenches

value.original: Attributes are specific to a Product Attribute Set (e.g. Size for T-Shirts: S,M,L). If you have multiple attributes and want to search under a common sttribute, you define a search sttribute. Example: have one Size search attribute combining the values of all different sizes (Size for Dress Shirt XL,L,M,S,XS). The Attribute Search allows you to have all values available for selection. This eases the maintenance of the individual product attribute.

row.value: Attributes are specific to a Product Attribute Set (e.g. Size for T-Shirts: S,M,L). If you have multiple attributes and want to search under a common sttribute, you define a search sttribute. Example: have one Size search attribute combining the values of all different sizes (Size for Dress Shirt XL,L,M,S,XS). The Attribute Search allows you to have all values available for selection. This eases the maintenance of the individual product attribute.

Web Clicks allow you to track number of clicks. Example: <a href="http://www.compiere.com/wstore/click?http://www.compiere.de" target="_blank"> where "http://www.compiere.com/wstore/click" is your side and "http://www.compiere.de" is the target page. If you created a web click for http://www.compiere.de, you will be able to see details and total of web clicks.
A web counter maintains how often a page or item was displayed. Add a call to http://www.compiere.com/wstore/counter to the page (e.g. display a 1x1 image)

value.original: Allows the bank statement import configuration and its execution
You way want to check the balance of the import with "Validate Only" before importing. Unbalanced Journals are imported; the handling is based on your settings for the posting process.

row.value: You way want to check the balance of the import with "Validate Only" before importing. Unbalanced Journals are imported; the handling is based on your settings for the posting process. The optional balance check checks the entire import, not individual batches and journals.

value.original: Allows the invoice import configuration and its execution

Please set Y/N selections in the import loader format explicitly (e.g. as constants) and no not leave them NULL. A NULL value stands for "don't know".In general, selection boxes are not selected if the value is not "Y" (i.e. could be null or any other value). All tests are made on "Y" or "not Y" - i.e. NULL values are not "not Y", but NULL (don't know) - see SQL Language introductions.

row.value: Please set Y/N selections in the import loader format explicitly (e.g. as constants) and no not leave them NULL. A NULL value stands for "don't know". In general, selection boxes are not selected if the value is not "Y" (i.e. could be null or any other value). All tests are made on "Y" or "not Y" - i.e. NULL values are not "not Y", but NULL (don't know) - see SQL Language introductions.

value.original:
Data Replication Target Details. Set up your system completely on the central system, before setting up the replication. Define the Replication target here and export the database and import it on the remote system.

Before(!) entering transactions, Start the Replication Run to set up the remote system.

row.value:
Data Replication Target Details. Set up your system completely on the central system, before setting up the replication. Define the Replication target here and export the database and import it on the remote system.

Before(!) entering transactions, Start the Replication Run to set up the remote system.

value.original: When commercial traders enter into a contract for the purchase and sale of goods they are free to negotiate specific terms of their contract. These terms include the price, quantity, and characteristics of the goods. Every international contract will also contain what is referred to as an Incoterm (international commercial term). The Incoterm selected by the parties to the transaction will determine which party pays the cost of each segment of transport, who is responsible for loading & unloading of goods, and who bears the risk of loss at any given point during a given international shipment. Incoterms also influence Customs valuation basis of imported merchandise.

row.value: When commercial traders enter into a contract for the purchase and sale of goods they are free to negotiate specific terms of their contract. These terms include the price, quantity, and characteristics of the goods. Every international contract will also contain what is referred to as an Incoterm (international commercial term). The Incoterm selected by the parties to the transaction will determine which party pays the cost of each segment of transport, who is responsible for loading & unloading of goods, and who bears the risk of loss at any given point during a given international shipment. Incoterms also influence Customs valuation basis of imported merchandise.

value.original: Thorugh this window users can configuer different rappels when a client reaches a certain sales volume.
